ADDED NOTE: I just discovered that, while the Paste command won't pop up on a new, blank note, it will in notes that already have text.

Review.author: Andrei Scumpu
Review.star: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Review.comment: This would be a 4 or even 5 star app IF IT DIDN"T RANDOMLY DELETE NOTE CONTENT. You select a note that previously had tons of data you'd been compiling over a week and POOF, it's BLANK! No explanation whatsoever. From reading the comments, I realize others have encountered the same issue. This app WOULD BE PERFECT: fast, easy to use, intuitive, fast sync, ubiquitous sync to all devices and the web. BUT...it loses note content!!! :( Given that the whole point of notes is to preserve information, this app fails its core function in the most unpredictable manner and hence becomes absolutely useless. What a shame.

Review.author: Samuel Powers
Review.star: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Nice App, Glaring Issue
Review.comment: I really like the app and would like to give it 5 stars, but there is a glaring issue that has been simply overlooked. When using this on my tablet with a keyboard attached, it is really hard to be able to focus on the writing with that pencil icon always in the bottom right. I will be typing and then think that I may have mistyped the word, but I cannot read it because it is hidden beneath that icon. It would be awesome if the icon went away if you're not actively touching the screen. I would assume that is what would happen as other applications hide the buttons when you're not actively trying to press the buttons. It kind of takes away from the application itself, at least for me. I would be using this on a daily basis, but I think I am going to have to find an application that doesn't stop me from being able to read what I am writing. It's such a small thing, but it really takes away from the writing experience.

However, I really, really, really don't like the font they have chosen for writing the notes and it's not possible to change it.

Review.title: Best Note-Taking app. On any platform.

If you want to save photos, scanned notes, or record audios and playing widgets, there's Evernote for you. But for you who just need to write down important text notes, which you can look up for whenever you want, offline and online. No app is doing it better than Simplenote. Combine it with its web app, and the third party app Resophnotes for Windows. Your note taking experience is complete and seamless. I'm also thankful for their top-notch, responsive customer service experience.

That way the note on the previously offline device has a chance to sync with the server

Review.author: Ren茅 G
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Seamlessly integrates across web/tablet, simple but elegant user interface
Review.comment: There are a lot of note-taking apps out there, spanning the gamut between simplicity and feature-richness. Most of them are tailored for a specific type of user, and this one strikes a sweet spot for me. I mostly take notes on my tablet and later, after they have synchronized to the cloud, I organize them and, in certain case, copy them elsewhere. Simplenote allows me to do so seamlessly. Both the tablet and the web application are exercises in simple yet effective design. I very much like the possibility of publishing notes to the internet with a single push of a button, and also the markdown capabilities that allow for putting headlines, bold, italics, links, etc. into documents without being tied into a proprietary binary format like with other word processors or rich text editors. The tag-based organization structure takes some getting used to, but it's definitely a more extensible way of organizing one's notes across different themes and associations. I've searched for a good note-taking app for years, and now, it seems, the hunt is over.

It works good on my Mac running Mavericks, also good on my iPad running iOS 7. But I can't trust it on Android. ** update 6/18/2014 ** I just reinstalled it on my Galaxy Note 3 and my Android tablet. A note I had taken, that was updated, showed as updated on the phone, but not the tablet (it was, and still is, updated on my Mac). Later I checked the phone, and the "update" had been removed. Grr. The whole point of this app is to seamlessly keep everything in sync, everywhere. It totally fails at this. Looking for an alternative.

Other times it completely disregards any of the changes I made, and I lose a half hour's worth of work. I haven't been able to verify this but it seems to only happen in landscape mode. I don't know if this is just a problem on the Note Pro, but I really hope it's resolved soon. In the meantime, I'll be copy pasting my important notes into new notes as a backup.

Review.comment: UPDATE: Simplenote used to be the epitome of the "one thing well" design philosophy. Sync my text notes! Now notes fail to update on nexus 4. PREVIOUSLY: I was heartened to see a fix come out for Samsung devices but I still have no search bar on the galaxy tab in landscape mode after updating. Sync on the tab has also been an issue so we will see if that improves. I love automattic and would love to rely more on this app. Also, six digit numbers turn into links of some kind. Again, only in galaxy tab.

Review.title: Cannot Undo; sync error and sometimes don't sync; no manual sync button
Review.comment: Simplenote is a great cross platform notes system, but this android app lacks the essential Undo function. Editing on a phone often involves accidental mistakes, but there is no way to go back within this app. Update: I downgraded to 2 star, because the sync problem--as many reviewers have pointed out--is increasingly annoying for me. In addition to the repetitive text/note errors, sometimes the android app just don't sync even 10 mins after changes made in other end. So I request a manual sync button.

Update: 2/6/2014: I have now experienced a sync issue -- I edit some text on my phone, and then look for it in the browser a minute or two later and it has not updated. Neither refreshing the page nor closing & reopening the app force a sync -- and there is no way to force a sync that I can see. ------ I have not experienced any sync or data loss issues with this app and the web app and have tested it multiple ways. Can someone who is post some steps to reproduce the problem? I wish the app let you swipe to the right while in a note to go back to the list of notes. But other than that, I love this and the web service (except for lack of keyboard shortcuts).

All texts can be found in Simplenote's main document list. Everything is furthermore synced to other devices that support Simplenote. You can tag all text documents with single words you feel describe them, so you can search for the tag words in the future. Simple GUI, functional design - great app.

Review.author: David Gardner
Review.star: Rated 2 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Using Glance Note Instead Until They Stabilize the Syncing
Review.comment: Researched. Rejected these: Evernote ... not all of its notes are available offline. SpringPad ... no way to backup your notes. Google Keep ... no way to backup notes, and no tagging. So I decided to go with simplenote. It didn't have photos or audio notes, but I value importing and backing up much higher. The web portal for it is also pretty good. Everything looked good until one day I noticed that it was repeating chunks of some of my notes, sometimes 10 times -- when viewed through their web portal. And then about a week later I noticed that it has also erased some of my content. So, about 2 weeks ago, I began using the app Glance Note, which accesses your Simplenote data online. I figure I can keep using it until Simplenote gets their app figured out. It's not as nice as simplenote ( it takes two taps to edit a note, and tagging is clumsy), but so far, it hasn't messed up any of my notes. And that's what I find most important in a Notes app. Hoping these guys get SimpleNote working well!

Review.title: Back to Evernote
Review.comment: I'm an Evernote refugee who was attracted by Simplenote's promise of a clean interface and rock-solid sync. And the iOS and OS X apps deliver on that promise. Unfortunately, even over multiple update cycles, the Android app on my stock (non-rooted) KitKat Nexus 7 loses note data constantly. The steps to reproduce are simple: Start writing a note, then switch away to another app or to the home screen. Upon returning, more often than not, you'll find that a portion of the note (sometimes a large portion) has been lost. Gorgeous app, but one star for not being able to master the basic requirement of retaining my data.

Now it looks poetic: Lessons Three Invite everyone's friends Public circles circles circles circles circles circles circles circles circles circles Compact center Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Hold the arms Go steady Go steady Go steady Go steady Go steady Talk more Go ge

Ive been trying to replace the glorious catch app. i still use it on my phone/app, even though syncing is now broken. And its still MILES ahead in usability. I think the devs are using the simplicity as a cover to not do anything with this app. Its so seriously benign, that its stunning that it can be called an accomplishment. Review.author: Lucas Nicodemus
Review.star: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Review.title: Fantastic
Review.comment: I was ready for this to be a crummy iOS port. Initially, it had issues with sync & battery drain, but after emailing Automattic, they responded the next day that those issues were fixed. Simplenote has no note length limit (unlike Google Keep) and the web version supports Markdown - the canonical method to format text without dealing with a rich text editor. Sync is nearly instantaneous, and I use it for a combination of lecture notes, as well as minor tidbits of info I might forget. It handles both tasks perfectly. If you're looking for a great cross platform note taking solution that's lightweight, this is the app to go with. It's a cross between Evernote and Keep, but one that keeps the best of both worlds.

Review.author: Brian Binder
Review.star: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Review.title: I know people are excited...
Review.comment: But seriously, no room for improvement on the app? 5 stars across the board? I like the enthusiasm, honestly. I have used the app, and only for a day so far, and I'm glad that it's better than all the "simplenote compatible" apps out there. Are you guys going to be adding a feature for sharing/publishing to the web from your phone and optionally emailing a link? That's pretty handy and I always enjoy(ed) doing this in the iOS platform when I needed to share information quickly, and then remove it once I knew the party had copied the needed information. Yes, I know the share option is there, but it still didn't allow for publishing the actual note and leaving it published via that link that others can connect to later. I still have to do that from the web, and that's a convenience I'd rather have in the app. There are 3 options I would like, since I have a ton of notes and the convenience could simply be added as a future option, or set of options. 1> Alternating row theme, as a settings option. 2> Highlight the search section on a per-note basis if enabled in settings. (Call out the sentence with the word(s) you searched for) 3> Tap and hold to [un]share/publish/delete, etc.
